top_categories.workout_context: At mile 60 of 129, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
Belgian Waffle Ride Asheville's Blue Ridge Mountains gravel (60%), Pavement (30%) forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 129 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Belgian Waffle Ride Asheville's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
78ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Belgian Waffle Ride Asheville, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
10,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
10,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Belgian Waffle Ride Asheville. Train it until it feels boring.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 129 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Belgian Waffle Ride Asheville, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on belgian-style mixed terrain—Blue Ridge Mountains. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
129 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.

race_overlay.heat: May in Asheville, North Carolina can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Belgian Waffle Ride Asheville. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Belgian Waffle Ride Asheville’s 129 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Belgian Waffle Ride Asheville. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Belgian Waffle Ride Asheville demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride belgian-style mixed terrain—blue ridge mountains at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: blue ridge mountains gravel (60%), pavement (30%), dirt roads (10%). Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 129 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 129 miles of belgian-style mixed terrain—blue ridge mountains in Asheville, North Carolina.
